channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Assorted rubbish, 5th January
item.description:
Assorted rubbish left next to bin near park entrance in Lakeside Close

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakeside Close, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge piles getting worse, 5th January
item.description:
Not sure why this pile up of flu tipping has been marked as "fixed" when all the original items remain, and as expected, has been added to. There is a desk top and cupboard by the recycling bins next to the children's playground, a 3 piece sofa set in the greenery outside of Glover House entrance, there are various parts and kitchen units outside another entrance, and a cupboard blocking the bins. It's creating a pest problem. People are bringing their waste from off-site because of the problem. This has been an issue since September.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge amount of litter, dumped household furniture and tvs, 5th January
item.description:
Please can you have a clean of Graveney Grove (along the back walls of numbers 1-5) and the grass verge along Evergreen Close. Dumped TVs, furniture abs endless small rubbish everywhere

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodbine Grove, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lifts within Lingfield house, 5th January
item.description:
Cleaner proceed to clean the urine in our lifts then used the same disgusting mop to wash outside them ( not that it make a difference but the lift was used has a toilet by junkies) and who knows what diseases he has now pushed about , kids prams disabled all have to use it , the mop was actually black !!! The cleaning on this estate is becoming a big problem and only gets done if residents complain, he turns up at 6.30 gone by 6.45 am that’s when he actually turns up , !! This has been going on for a long time ( +6 months) it’s not acceptable anymore
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lancaster Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction visibility blocked, 5th January
item.description:
The large public recycling bins have been moved close to the kerb, blocking visibility on a fairly busy junction. They used to be set further back from the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water Leakage on Pavements, 5th January
item.description:
Ongoing water leakage is flooding the pavement and causing erosion of the surface. The pavement is becoming increasingly unsafe and slippery, with flowing water and mud covering the footway. This poses a safety risk to pedestrians and may worsen if not addressed promptly

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dursley Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bun overflow /furniture, 5th January
item.description:
Se77fu outside lockington apartments 4 gallions road Electric recycling overflowing with refuse not Electric recycling. Large furniture items dumped blocking fire exit Reported 4 times now. Vermin are living in recycling bins it's stinking.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gallions Road, Charlton
